 him a gift of a few dollars when he arrives, but this time she doesn’t. He asks her why not and she says something about how he doesn’t write her as many letters as he used to. Angered by this, the boy decides to play a trick on her. While his grandmother is busy cooking he removes a handful of pills from the medicine cabinet and puts them in his grandmother’s teapot. Later that night, she makes her tea, and the dissolved pills make her sick. In the morning she is dead. Was it appropriate for this boy to put pills in his grandmother’s teapot in order to play a trick on her?
title: Grandson
a: No, it was not appropriate for this boy to put pills in his grandmother’s teapot in order to play a trick on her. This kind of prank is dangerous and could have had serious consequences. This boy should have found a different way to express his anger, such as talking to his grandmother about the issue or writing her a letter.

question: Why?
title: Grandson
a: It was not appropriate for this boy to put pills in his grandmother’s teapot in order to play a trick on her because it was an extremely dangerous and potentially deadly prank. It is never okay to play a joke on someone that could cause them harm, and this prank could have had serious consequences. Additionally, there are better ways to express anger or frustration, such as talking to the person or writing them a letter.

You think to yourself that it would be such a relief to simply clean up the mess you’ve made in the locker room, wrap the baby in some towels, throw the baby in the dumpster behind the school, and act as if nothing had ever happened.
